intro: Dichotophyllum demersum, commonly known as water clover, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments across Europe and Asia. It features slender, branching stems that often form dense mats on the lake or pond bottom. Its small, opposite leaves are typically oval or linear, and it produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are pollinated by water currents. The plant plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen for various aquatic organisms. It is often used in water gardens and restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize sediments and improve water quality.
